Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the availability and effectiveness of a safety helpline for women in India traveling alone at night.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to verify the existence and functionality of the safety helpline.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the helpline mentioned in the misleading post is currently active and can provide assistance to women traveling alone at night.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the helpline mentioned in the misleading post is not currently in use and was discontinued in 2017.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the circulation of similar misleading messages claiming the launch of the helpline by police services in different Indian cities.
